results.title: What's the name of this show

Episode of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
The making of puppets and preparations for a puppet show provide the children with an opportunity to practice some group organisation.

results.title: What's so funny?
results.creator_credit: Steve Westh, Australian Film Commission and Tony Wright
results.brief_description: Humour based on ‘ethnic’ stereotypes is problematic. The situation is confounded/complicated when delivered from someone within that ethnic group. This documentary looks at Australia’s most prominent (some say only), Vietnamese stand-up comic - Hung Le. Hung talks of his childhood in Vietnam, the move to Australia, the experiences of his family as migrants, his passion for the Carlton football club, and how he came into comedy. It explores the “Wogs out of work” phenomenon (of which Hung was involved), and includes interviews with other ‘ethnic’ comedians Vince Sorrenti, Anthony Mir and Peter Saleh, amongst others. Features excerpts of successful and not so successful stand-up routines.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Westh, Australian Film Commission and Tony Wright

results.title: What's new in solid waste management
results.brief_description: Describes a number of research and demonstration projects contributing to solid waste management technology in the United States. It is intended to provide useful data for the comparative analysis of these emerging new systems without the necessity of making expensive field trips. Though semi-technical and specifically intended for public officials who authorize and fund solid waste collections and disposal operations, the film is also understandable to non-technicians.

results.title: What's it all about, Harry?
results.brief_description: Harry and young Greg go shopping. As they shop Greg asks Harry how many bells does he give for help advice and service at each business. Harry is a telephone technician and he explains the problems dealing with various customers.

results.title: What's it all about
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, Brian Bergin and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the idea that our education should not stop with the end of formal studies. Claims that we must learn to accept and adapt to social change.

results.title: What's in it for me? (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
Since a manager’s main function is to work with people to achieve the organisation’s purpose, having an understanding of how people are motivated is essential to knowing how to improve satisfaction and individual performance. Features studio guests such as Laurie Carmichael, formerly one of Australia’s most powerful and influential trade union leaders, and Richard Pratt, Chairman of Pratt Industries, discussing the issue of employees and motivation.

results.title: What's in a symbol?
results.creator_credit: League of Red Cross Societies et al and Gyorgy Karpati
results.brief_description: A documentary of the history and activities of the Red Cross from its foundation in 1859 to the present day. Emphasises its role in providing help and protection to citizens worldwide. Depicts delegates and volunteers at work in war zones, assisting refugees and prisoners, tracing families and working with the urban poor and drug addicts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: League of Red Cross Societies et al and Gyorgy Karpati

results.title: What's in a spider web (observing animals)
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description: Notes the difference between spiders and insects, the various methods spiders have of weaving webs, their methods of trapping prey, and the laying of eggs. From the series “Science fact and fun series”.

results.title: What's in a shadow?: Finding directions
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the measurement of shadows throughout the day to determine the sun’s position and how to use this knowledge to find one’s direction. Also defines the earth’s relationship to the sun.

results.title: What's in a sandpit?
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and Ross Campbell
results.brief_description: No 2 in a series of in-service science education films produced for the Curriculum and research Branch for discussion purposes. This film is to be used to introduce the new Primary Science course. A group of teachers discuss how they might plan work for their pupils. Various problems are discussed. From the “Science in Primary School” series.
